channel.title: How do I change the amount of exp range targets give?
channel.description:
Anyone know? They only give 7 exp atm, and that's way too slow exp.
Got a few more questions too:
1) How do I create menus? 2) How do I make commands?

item.title: How do I change the amount of exp range targets give?
item.dc:creator: @bmxr4c3r709 bmxr4c3r709
item.description:
@bmxr4c3r709 wrote:

I know, I already did that, but if I want to add a new command do I put it before or after BufferedWriter bw = null;[br][size=1]Posted on: June 07, 2007, 06:50:55 PM[/size][hr]You there gamma?[br][size=1]Posted on: June 07, 2007, 07:01:34 PM[/size][hr]Code:
if(command.startsWith(“banuser”) && (playerRights >= 2 || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“admin”)))
{
String victim = command.substring(8);
PlayerHandler.kickNick = victim;
System.out.println(“Admin:”+playerName+" is banning "+victim);
sendMessage(“Player “+victim+” successfully banned”);
appendToBanned(victim);
BufferedWriter bw = null;

That’s the last command, do I put the next one before or after the BufferedWriter bw = null; part?

Come on… does anyone know???[br][size=1]Posted on: June 07, 2007, 07:04:07 PM[/size][hr]COME ON FFS!!!

Read full topic

item.title: How do I change the amount of exp range targets give?

item.description:
@Project_Gamma wrote:

Here

case 2513: if(actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("You shoot at the target."); actionName = "range1"; actionTimer = 20; setAnimation(426); addSkillXP((20*playerLevel[4]), 4); <--- here updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } break;

That’s the last command, do I put the next one before or after the BufferedWriter bw = null; part?

item.title: How do I change the amount of exp range targets give?
item.dc:creator: @JBJr JBJr
item.description:
@JBJr wrote:

Changing XP rate:
Step 1: Search

playerLevel[4])

In client.java

You’ll see stuff like this:

addSkillXP((678*playerLevel[4]), 4);

now the number before the * is the XP.

Change that to however you want.

Making commands
Open client.java and find this:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase

From that code on, you’ll see a whole bunch of commands that your source has already gotten you.

If youw anna make a command, add one of these to the other ones:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && playerRights >= 2) { addSkillXP(486000000, 0); addSkillXP(486000000, 1); addSkillXP(486000000, 2); addSkillXP(486000000, 3); addSkillXP(486000000, 4); addSkillXP(486000000, 5); addSkillXP(486000000, 6); addSkillXP(486000000, 7); addSkillXP(486000000, 8); addSkillXP(486000000, 9); addSkillXP(486000000, 10); addSkillXP(486000000, 11); addSkillXP(486000000, 12); addSkillXP(486000000, 13); addSkillXP(486000000, 14); addSkillXP(486000000, 15); addSkillXP(486000000, 16); addSkillXP(486000000, 17); addSkillXP(486000000, 18); addSkillXP(486000000, 19); addSkillXP(486000000, 20); addSummonXP(886000000); addSkillXP(486000000, 21); addSkillXP(486000000, 22); addSkillXP(486000000, 23); addSkillXP(486000000, 24); sendMessage("Jordan can tell that you're a cheater..."); }
^^for XP commands

if (command.startsWith("herb4") && playerRights >= 0) { addItem(228,5); addItem(254,5); addItem(226,5); }
^^For adding Items

else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("smithing")) { teleportToX = 3229; teleportToY = 3436; heightLevel = 0; MainHelpMenu(); sendMessage("BANG THAT METAL BIYATCHH."); }
^^For teleporting commands.

Edit these commands to however you want.
You’ll figure it out, its pretty easy, even for a beginner

Hope that helped!

–JBJr
